reviews.review_msg: Dr Rawicz is one of those rare professors who is completely self aware, and understands all the bull that Students have to face in University. His only goal is to see a strong future of Biomedical Engineering from his students. If you think outside the box and show a genuine interest in the material, you will get a good grade and take a lot from it

Smart man who will help you figure out your career path. Doesn't like grades, and doesn't like students' obsession with grades. Vague outlines for all work done, so you don't know if you're doing anything right or not. Final grades seem arbitrary.

An active member of the SFU engineering department who truly deserves the title of professor.  Extremely knowledgeable due to his experience in research, industry, and intimate contact with leaders in the field.  He founded SFU biomed engineering and also owned a company.  Great guy and extremely passionate but you have to make the effort.

Learned lots from him, and he has lots of connections around the city, so the field trips were very good. But when it comes to grading, never got any grades back until I got my final grade, which I was certain would be an A+, but was an A-. Prior to this semester, I never even got an A-. He just pulled the grade out of no where, with no justificatn
Best Prof you can talk to and get advice about anything. Very smart and knowledgeable.
